articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jody Godoy
articles.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried was found guilty on Thursday of defrauding customers of his now-bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange in one of the biggest financial frauds on record, a verdict that cemented the 31-year-old former billionaire's fall from grace.
articles.title: Ex-crypto mogul Sam Bankman-Fried convicted of defrauding FTX customers

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. job growth likely slowed in October partly due to strikes by the United Auto Workers (UAW) union against Detroit's "Big Three" car makers, which depressed manufacturing payrolls.
articles.title: US job growth probably slowed in October due to UAW strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Apple fell 3% on Friday after it disappointed Wall Street with a forecast that indicated growth will stay subdued in the quarter where the holiday season usually drives its strongest sales.
articles.title: Apple tumbles after warning of dull holiday quarter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI will release its first AI model to a select group on Saturday, the billionaire and Tesla (TSLA.O) CEO said on Friday.
articles.title: Musk's xAI set to launch first AI model to select group

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Amazon (AMZN.O) founder Jeff Bezos said on Thursday he was moving to his childhood home of Miami from Seattle to be near his parents and his space firm Blue Origin's Cape Canaveral operations.
articles.title: Amazon founder Bezos plans move to Miami from Seattle

articles.author: David Milliken
articles.description: Britain's services businesses suffered a loss of momentum for a third month in a row in October, adding to signs the economy is making a weak finish to 2023 as high interest rates and cost of living pressures weigh on demand.
articles.title: UK services businesses 'skirt with recession' in Oct-PMI survey

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's commerce minister told Micron Technology Inc's (MU.O) president Beijing would welcome the U.S. semiconductor company deepening its footprint in the Chinese market, signally a further thaw in relations between the world's top two economies.
articles.title: China warms to U.S. chipmaker Micron, as tensions with Washington ease

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The top U.S. diplomat planned on Friday to urge Israel to agree to multiple pauses in its war against Hamas militants in Gaza to allow humanitarian aid to enter and help people safely exit while Israel said it encircled the Palestinian enclave's biggest city.
articles.title: US to call on Israel to implement humanitarian pauses in Gaza

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Russia launched a massive drone attack early on Friday, hitting critical infrastructure in the west and south of Ukraine and destroying private houses and commercial buildings in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city, officials said.
articles.title: Russia's biggest drone strike in weeks hits Ukrainian infrastructure

articles.author: Edward Mcallister, David Lewis, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Before United Nations peacekeepers hurriedly abandoned their base in Kidal in northern Mali on Tuesday, they made a costly call: with insurgents stationed nearby, they destroyed sensitive equipment to avoid it falling into the wrong hands, the U.N. said.
articles.title: UN retreat from Mali in disarray as violence surges
